abstract: While Apple claims it is still considering the iPhone application for Google Voice, Google says the company rejected the app outright because it could replace core functions of the iPhone’s dialer software.
snippet: While Apple claims it is still considering the iPhone application for Google Voice, Google says the company rejected the app outright because it could replace core functions of the iPhone’s dialer software.
lead_paragraph: When Apple sent a letter to the government in response to an inquiry about its treatment of Google Voice’s proposed iPhone application, it seemed as if Apple had opened a pinhole in the curtain of secrecy that usually surrounds its Cupertino, Calif., headquarters.

headline.main: Google Says Apple Flatly Rejected Voice App for iPhone
